text: František Plesnivý (4 April 1845 – 9 August 1918) was a Czech architect known for his Art Nouveau early designs and utilitarian later designs.Čáp, J., & Čížek, J., "Historické průmyslové stavby: Textilní firma Josef Bartoň a synové, přádelna Staré Město nad Metují", in Náchodský zpravodaj, #9, 2019, p. 7. Among his many buildings is Ettrichova Vila, the Jaroměř (present-day Czech Republic) house featured prominently in Jan Hřebejk's 2000 film Divided We Fall,Potůček, J., "Vila Josefa Ettricha má nádech elegantní francouzské architektury", Novinky.cz, March 6, 2013. which during the late 19th century was frequented by admirers such as Emperor Franz Joseph I.Vila Josefa Ettricha, SlavneVily.cz. In 1897 František Plesnivý designed and constructed a villa for his family in Nový Hradec Králové, Villa Gabriela, named after his wife. During the early 20th century Plesnivý also designed and built churches,"Kaple Neposkvrněného početí Panny Marie 'na Rožberku', Slezské Předměstí", Association of Historical Settlements in Bohemia, Moravia and Silesia. factoriesWaisserová, A., "Lederer & Adler, mechanická továrna na obuv", Litomyšlský architektonický manuál.Skřivánek, M., Litomyšl 1259-2009: City of Culture and Education (Litomyšl: City of Litomyšl, 2009), pp. 272–275. and public utility structures such as water towers.Water reservoir tower, Česká Třebová, vodarenskeveze.cz. The architect František Plesnivý died on August 9, 1918 in Villa Gabriela, Nový Hradec Králové. ==Distinctions== In 1898, at the Architecture and Engineering Exhibition, Plesnivý was awarded the Silver Medal of the City of Prague.Vlček, P., ed., Encyklopedie architektů, stavitelů, zedníků a kameníků v Čechách (Prague: Academia, 2004), p. 508. ==References== ==External links== Category:1845 births Category:1918 deaths Category:Austro-Hungarian architects Category:Czech architects Category:Art Nouveau architects Category:Functionalist architects Category:People from Kladno District
